meanings.definition: A strong adhesive used for bonding materials together.
meanings.sent1: I used epoxy to stick the broken pieces of my favorite mug back together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter applied epoxy to join the pieces of wood securely.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef mistook epoxy for honey and accidentally glued the cookbook shut.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was like epoxy, always keeping us close and connected.
meanings.sent5: The epoxy created a bond so strong, even time couldn't break it.

meanings.definition: A type of resin that hardens when mixed with a curing agent.
meanings.sent1: The artist used epoxy to create a shiny coating on the painting.
meanings.sent2: Epoxy is commonly used in flooring to provide a durable finish.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought the epoxy was magic potion that turned everything hard.
meanings.sent4: His words were like epoxy, slowly hardening her heart against him.
meanings.sent5: The epoxy hardened into a protective layer, preserving the artwork for years to come.

meanings.definition: To fasten or seal with epoxy.
meanings.sent1: I need to epoxy the loose tile back onto the bathroom floor.
meanings.sent2: She decided to epoxy the edges of the window to prevent drafts.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret weapon was the ability to epoxy anything in seconds.
meanings.sent4: His promise to always epoxy her heart was sealed with a kiss.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to epoxy a crucial component to fix the spaceship.
